meanings.definition: A thick stick of blackthorn or oak used in Ireland, typically as a weapon.
meanings.sent1: In the old days, people in Ireland carried shillelaghs for protection.
meanings.sent2: The Irishman swung his shillelagh with great force.
meanings.sent3: When the leprechaun lost his shillelagh, he couldn't defend himself anymore.
meanings.sent4: His words were like sharp shillelaghs, striking deep into her heart.
meanings.sent5: The shillelagh gleamed in the moonlight, ready for battle.

meanings.definition: A cudgel or club made of this wood.
meanings.sent1: The hooligan threatened the crowd with his shillelagh.
meanings.sent2: She carved intricate designs on her shillelagh to make it unique.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf used his shillelagh to play drums on the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the forest, as if accompanied by a shillelagh orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The shillelagh felt heavy in his hand, a symbol of his authority.
